Skiing & Snowboarding in Park City

7,300+ Acres of World-Class Terrain Across Two Premier Resorts

Park City Mountain Resort

The largest ski resort in the United States with 7,300 acres of terrain

Resort Stats

  • 7,300 acres of skiable terrain
  • 41 lifts including 2 gondolas
  • 330+ trails for all levels
  • 3,200 feet of vertical drop
  • 8 terrain parks
  • 13 bowls for powder days

Trail Breakdown

  • 17% Beginner (Green)
  • 52% Intermediate (Blue)
  • 31% Advanced/Expert (Black)
  • Average annual snowfall: 355"
  • Season: Late November - April
Visit Website

Must-Ski Runs

  • Homerun: Classic groomer from top to base
  • McConkey's Bowl: Epic powder stash
  • King Con: Long cruiser with views
  • Jupiter Bowl: Expert terrain paradise
  • Canyons Village: Variety for all levels

Deer Valley Resort

Luxury skiing experience with meticulously groomed runs and world-class service

Resort Stats

  • 2,026 acres of terrain
  • 21 lifts with limited ticket sales
  • 103 runs across 6 mountains
  • 3,000 feet of vertical drop
  • Skiers only - no snowboarding
  • Award-winning grooming

Trail Breakdown

  • 27% Beginner (Green)
  • 41% Intermediate (Blue)
  • 32% Advanced/Expert (Black)
  • 300+ inches annual snowfall
  • Season: Early December - April
Visit Website

Signature Experiences

  • Stein's Way: Perfect intermediate cruiser
  • Mayflower Bowl: Untouched powder
  • Empire Canyon: Advanced tree skiing
  • Little Baldy: Scenic beginner area
  • St. Regis Deer Valley: Ski-in dining

Lift Tickets & Passes

Park City Mountain

Part of Epic Pass network

  • Day tickets: $200-300+ (peak season)
  • Epic Pass: Full season access
  • Epic Local Pass: Limited days
  • Multi-day tickets save 20-30%
  • Book online for best rates

Deer Valley

Part of Ikon Pass network

  • Day tickets: $250-350+ (peak season)
  • Ikon Pass: 5-7 days included
  • Advance purchase discounts
  • Limited daily ticket sales
  • Reserve early for holidays

Money-Saving Tips

  • Buy passes before October for best prices
  • Mid-week skiing saves 20-30%
  • Early/late season deals
  • Package deals with lodging
  • Kids ski free programs

Ski & Snowboard Schools

Beginner Programs

  • First-timer packages with rental & lift
  • Group lessons from $200/day
  • Kids camps (ages 3-14)
  • Adult beginner zones
  • Guaranteed learn-to-ski programs

Advanced Coaching

  • Private lessons from $800/day
  • Steep & deep workshops
  • Mogul technique clinics
  • Race training programs
  • Women's ski camps

Specialty Programs

  • Adaptive skiing for all abilities
  • Telemark lessons
  • Backcountry intro courses
  • Freestyle & park lessons
  • Multi-day improvement camps

Equipment Rentals

On-Mountain Rentals

  • Premium ski/board packages: $70-100/day
  • Demo equipment available
  • Kids rentals from $40/day
  • Helmet included with rental
  • Slope-side pickup locations

Town Rental Shops

  • 20-30% cheaper than on-mountain
  • Multi-day discounts available
  • Free overnight storage
  • Delivery to lodging
  • Book online for best rates

What to Rent

  • Standard: Good for most skiers
  • Performance: Latest models
  • Demo: Try before buying
  • Powder skis: For deep days
  • Kids seasonal: Great value

Insider Tips

  • Beat the crowds: First tracks start at 8:30 AM - be on the first lift
  • Powder days: Head to Jupiter Bowl (PCMR) or Mayflower (DV) early
  • Parking: Arrive before 8:30 AM on weekends or use free transit
  • Weather: Check snow reports night before - storms often arrive overnight
  • Lunch strategy: Eat early (11:30) or late (1:30) to avoid crowds
  • End of day: Ski Town Lift at PCMR for easy base access
  • Free skiing: Kids 5 and under ski free at both resorts
  • Best views: Take Orange Bubble Express for panoramic photos

    • Beyond the Resorts

    Cross-Country Skiing

    • White Pine Touring Center
    • Round Valley trails
    • Soldier Hollow (Olympic venue)
    • Mountain Dell Golf Course
    • Equipment rentals available

    Backcountry Access

    • Guided tours recommended
    • Avalanche education required
    • Popular zones: Big Cottonwood
    • Beacon/shovel/probe rental
    • Check avalanche conditions

    Other Winter Fun

    • Snowshoeing trails everywhere
    • Tubing at Gorgoza Park
    • Ice skating at multiple rinks
    • Snowmobile tours
    • Dog sledding adventures
